literals: "The example minion will fight for you"
"Summons an example minion to fight for you"
comments: This lets the player target anywhere on the whole screen while using a controller.
These below are needed for a minion weapon
No buffTime because otherwise the item tooltip would say something like "1 minute duration"
This is needed so the buff that keeps your minion alive and allows you to despawn it properly applies
Here you can change where the minion is spawned. Most vanilla minions spawn at the cursor position. We also zero out the initial velocity.
Sets the amount of frames this minion has on its spritesheet
This is necessary for right-click targeting
These below are needed for a minion weapon
Denotes that this projectile is a pet or minion
This is needed so your minion can properly spawn when summoned and replaced when other minions are summoned
Don't mistake this with "if this is true, then it will automatically home". It is just for damage reduction for certain NPCs
Makes the minion go through tiles freely
These below are needed for a minion weapon
Needed for custom AI
Only controls if it deals damage to enemies on contact (more on that later)
Only determines the damage type
Amount of slots this minion occupies from the total minion slots available to the player (more on that later)
Needed so the minion doesn't despawn on collision with enemies or tiles
Here you can decide if your minion breaks things like grass or pots
This is mandatory if your minion deals contact damage (further related stuff in AI() in the Movement region)
This is the "active check", makes sure the minion is alive while the player is alive, and despawns if not
Go up 48 coordinates (three tiles from the center of the player)
If your minion doesn't aimlessly move around when it's idle, you need to "put" it into the line of other summoned minions
The index is projectile.minionPos
Go behind the player
All of this code below this line is adapted from Spazmamini code (ID 388, aiStyle 66)
Teleport to player if is distance too big
Whenever you deal with non-regular events that change the behavior or position drastically, make sure to only run the code on the owner of the projectile,
and then set netUpdate to true
If your minion is flying, you want to do this independently of any conditions
Fix overlap with other minions
Starting search distance
This code is required if your minion weapon has the targeting feature
Reasonable distance away so it doesn't target across multiple screens
This code is required either way, used for finding a target
Additional check for this specific minion behavior, otherwise it will stop attacking once it dashed through an enemy while flying though tiles afterwards
The number depends on various parameters seen in the movement code below. Test different ones out until it works alright
friendly needs to be set to true so the minion can deal contact damage
friendly needs to be set to false so it doesn't damage things like target dummies while idling
Both things depend on if it has a target or not, so it's just one assignment here
You don't need this assignment if your minion is shooting things instead of dealing contact damage
Default movement parameters (here for attacking)
Minion has a target: attack (here, fly towards the enemy)
The immediate range around the target (so it doesn't latch onto it when close)
Minion doesn't have a target: return to player and idle
Speed up the minion if it's away from the player
Slow down the minion if closer to the player
The immediate range around the player (when it passively floats about)
This is a simple movement formula using the two parameters and its desired direction to create a "homing" movement
If there is a case where it's not moving at all, give it a little "poke"
So it will lean slightly towards the direction it's moving
This is a simple "loop through all frames from top to bottom" animation
Some visuals here
docstrings:
* This file contains all the code necessary for a minion
	 * - ModItem
	 *     the weapon which you use to summon the minion with
	 * - ModBuff
	 *     the icon you can click on to despawn the minion
	 * - ModProjectile 
	 *     the minion itself
	 *     
	 * It is not recommended to put all these classes in the same file. For demonstrations sake they are all compacted together so you get a better overwiew.
	 * To get a better understanding of how everything works together, and how to code minion AI, read the guide: https://github.com/tModLoader/tModLoader/wiki/Basic-Minion-Guide
	 * This is NOT an in-depth guide to advanced minion AI

* This minion shows a few mandatory things that make it behave properly. 
	 * Its attack pattern is simple: If an enemy is in range of 43 tiles, it will fly to it and deal contact damage
	 * If the player targets a certain NPC with right-click, it will fly through tiles to it
	 * If it isn't attacking, it will float near the player with minimal movement
